definition: to hit (the mark)/to be hit by/to suffer/to win (a prize, a lottery)
between/among/within a definite time or space/room/section of a room or lateral space between two pairs of pillars/classifier for rooms
gap/to separate/to thin out (seedlings)/to sow discontent
commerce/merchant/dealer/to consult/2nd note in pentatonic scale/quotient (as in 智商[zhi4 shang1], intelligence quotient)

sentences.english: The L/C is used by an agent to do business.
sentences.chinese: 中間商用來做轉手買賣而使用的一種信用證。

sentences.english: The government blames middle men who collect milk from dairy farmers.
sentences.chinese: 政府歸罪於從奶牛養殖者手中收購牛奶的中間商。

sentences.english: The government blames middlemen who collect milk from dairy farmers.
sentences.chinese: 政府將問題歸咎於向奶農採購牛奶的中間商。

sentences.english: The second is the difficulties of being a middleman.
sentences.chinese: 第二，作爲一個“中間商”實在不易。

sentences.english: There are several intermediaries between the producers and end users.
sentences.chinese: 在製造商和最終用戶之間要經過幾位中間商。

sentences.english: Returns from intermediaries are very different from end-customer returns.
sentences.chinese: 中間商退貨和終端客戶退貨截然不同。

definition: bad money drives out good money (economics)
pinyin: lie4 bi4 qu1 zhu2 liang2 bi4

definition: (coll.) to tamper with/to mess around with
to be a cinch/in the bag/(of a person) confident of success
